isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - BRAKE SHOES AND/OR SPRINGS, REPLACE - REAR BRAKES (INBOARD DRUMS)

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: BRAKE SHOES AND/OR SPRINGS, REPLACE - REAR BRAKES (INBOARD DRUMS)

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Raise vehicle and support axle being serviced with stands.
Back off brakes on wheel being serviced.

note.para: On rear wheels with spring brake air chambers, cage spring brake air chamber and then back off brake being serviced.

step1.para: Remove nuts retaining axle shaft. Remove axle shaft and gasket. Catch fluid.
Remove lock nut, washer, adjusting nut, and outer bearing.
Using wheel dolly, remove wheel and hub as an assembly.
Using suitable pry tool, lift brake shoe and remove both rollers and retaining clips. Note position of clip.

warning.para: Use caution to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Using suitable tool, remove brake shoe return spring (spring closest to brake cam).
Rotate upper shoe off spider assembly. Remove upper and lower shoes with brake shoe retaining springs attached.
Remove brake shoe retaining springs from brake shoes.
Remove anchor pins. Clean and lubricate anchor pins and bushings.
Replace wheel seal and axle shaft gasket.
Install anchor pins.
Install brake return spring pin into new brake shoes.
Install brake shoe retaining springs to upper and lower shoes.
Place upper brake shoe onto spider assembly.
Rotate lower brake shoe and install brake shoe return spring using suitable tool.
Install rollers and retaining clip. Note position of clip.
Adjust brake s-cam so that the rollers are in the s-cam hollow lowest point.
Install wheel / hub assembly using wheel dolly. Fill hub cavity with proper fluid.
Install outer bearing and adjusting nut. Remove wheel dolly. Adjust bearing preload. Install adjusting nut lock washer. Install lock nut. Torque to spec.
Install axle shaft gasket and axle shaft. Torque bolts to spec.
Adjust brakes on axle being serviced.

note.para: On rear wheels with spring brake air chamber, uncage spring brake. Release brakes using vehicle air pressure, then adjust brakes.

step1.para: Raise vehicle, remove stands and lower vehicle.
Check rear differential fluid level on axle being serviced. Top off as needed.
Remove wheel chocks.
